docs.abstract: Benchmark bottles were always a splurge. But an increasing concentration of wealth has put them out of reach for all but the richest connoisseurs.
docs.snippet: Benchmark bottles were always a splurge. But an increasing concentration of wealth has put them out of reach for all but the richest connoisseurs.
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the many ways the rich are different from you and me: Only they can afford grand cru Burgundy.

headline.main: How Income Inequality Has Erased Your Chance to Drink the Great Wines

docs.abstract: Ben Harris is not a household name, even in economics. But he helped develop a package of tax and spending increases that has not spooked Wall Street.
docs.snippet: Ben Harris is not a household name, even in economics. But he helped develop a package of tax and spending increases that has not spooked Wall Street.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In recent months Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s campaign developed a virtual road show to reassure executives, investment fund managers and financiers who were nervous that the Democratic candidate’s plans to increase taxes could hurt the American economic recovery.

headline.main: The Quiet Architect of Biden’s Plan to Rescue the Economy
headline.print_headline: The Biden Adviser Who Is Intriguing Both Wall Street And Progressives

docs.abstract: Meet the scholars who study civilizational collapse.
docs.snippet: Meet the scholars who study civilizational collapse.
docs.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

headline.main: How Do You Know When Society Is About to Fall Apart?

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

docs.abstract: “I see a coup as not a bad thing,” said one prominent royalist who publicly called for a military intervention to quell antigovernment rallies in Bangkok and to protect the monarchy.
docs.snippet: “I see a coup as not a bad thing,” said one prominent royalist who publicly called for a military intervention to quell antigovernment rallies in Bangkok and to protect the monarchy.
docs.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — There are certain constants in Thailand: the drenching monsoons, the grand openings of new shopping malls and the rumors that the Royal Thai Armed Forces are plotting another coup.

headline.main: Almost Like Clockwork, Talk of a Military Coup Follows Thai Protests
headline.print_headline: Almost Like Clockwork, Talk of a Military Coup Follows Protests in Thailand

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

docs.abstract: President Trump built in tax increases beginning in 2021, for nearly everyone but those at the very top.
docs.snippet: President Trump built in tax increases beginning in 2021, for nearly everyone but those at the very top.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration has a dirty little secret: It’s not just planning to increase taxes on most Americans. The increase has already been signed, sealed and delivered, buried in the pages of the 2017 Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.

headline.main: Republicans, Not Biden, Are About to Raise Your Taxes

docs.abstract: Buford Highway, in suburban Atlanta, has long been a place where immigrant entrepreneurs could build businesses and get ahead. Not this year.
docs.snippet: Buford Highway, in suburban Atlanta, has long been a place where immigrant entrepreneurs could build businesses and get ahead. Not this year.
docs.lead_paragraph: On April 20, 49 days after Georgia reported its first two coronavirus cases and 39 days after the announcement of the state’s first Covid-19-related death, Gov. Brian Kemp convened a news conference on the steps of the Capitol in downtown Atlanta. Speaking to an audience of masked journalists, Kemp opened his remarks by listing the most recent statistics from the Georgia Department of Public Health: 18,947 positive tests since the beginning of the pandemic and 733 deaths. “We understand that these are more than just numbers,” he said. “These are Georgians that we’re talking about.”

headline.main: When the Virus Came for the American Dream
headline.print_headline: WHEN THE VIRUS CAME FOR THE AMERICAN DREAM

docs.abstract: A committee that advises the C.D.C.’s director is working on a plan to equitably distribute immunizations when they become available.
docs.snippet: A committee that advises the C.D.C.’s director is working on a plan to equitably distribute immunizations when they become available.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is an idea that may never have been tried in wide-scale vaccine distribution: Citing principles of equity and justice, experts are urging that people living in communities hardest-hit by the pandemic, which are often made up of Black and Hispanic populations, get a portion of the first, limited supply of coronavirus vaccines set aside just for them.

headline.main: Will the Hardest-Hit Communities Get the Coronavirus Vaccine?
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. May Set Aside Doses of Vaccine for the Hardest-Hit Communities

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

docs.abstract: Coronavirus tests are free, yet data show some wealthy neighborhoods are testing at nearly four times the rate of poor neighborhoods. Why?
docs.snippet: Coronavirus tests are free, yet data show some wealthy neighborhoods are testing at nearly four times the rate of poor neighborhoods. Why?
docs.lead_paragraph: This week, in an anxious nation where nearly any encounter with a screen has become triggering, Kim Kardashian West took a shot with all her firepower, announcing plans for her 40th birthday. To the undoing of Twitter, she noted that she had flown friends and family to a private island to pretend “things were normal just for a brief moment.” The pandemic at the heart of the current peculiarities was easily circumvented by quarantine and “2 weeks of multiple health screens.”

headline.main: Some Areas of N.Y.C. Are Getting a Lot More Testing. Guess Which Ones.

docs.abstract: We need a better system of transferring patients to ensure the best care during the next phase of the pandemic.
docs.snippet: We need a better system of transferring patients to ensure the best care during the next phase of the pandemic.
docs.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich. — As hospitals in much of the country face a surge in patients with Covid-19 and the threat of influenza this fall and winter, we must be on guard against attempts to restrict patient admissions or limit intensive-care capacity. The incentives will certainly be there for hospitals to do so.

headline.main: Do Hospitals Value Everyone? This Winter, They Have a Chance to Prove It

docs.abstract: The people of Illinois, Arizona and California have a chance to make the distribution of state taxation a little more fair.
docs.snippet: The people of Illinois, Arizona and California have a chance to make the distribution of state taxation a little more fair.
docs.lead_paragraph: Most Americans accept the common-sense case for progressive taxation: Those who have more ought to contribute more to the society that is the foundation of their prosperity.
